pred_summary: The formula for the factorial, n!=n×(n−1)!{\displaystyle n!=n\times (n-1)!}, means that a smaller factorial is a factor of a larger factorial, and the largest common factorial is the smaller of the two factorials. This can be used to efficiently calculate the product of two large factorials, such as 5!×7!'.
